title: Pressing <Control> <B> to toggle BOLD On/Off  moves the cursor from the current position to the beginning of the line
content:
My Thunderbird was recently updated from the old 102 to the SUPERNOVA 115 version.

I noticed something very odd with version 115 when I press <Control> to toggle BOLD On/Off while composing my email text.

If I do not leave the Thunderbird window while composing my text, <Control><B> works okay.

However, if I switch from my Thunderbird Compose Email window to a different window (e.g. switch to a different application - e.g. a web browser) and then switch back to my Thunderbird Compose Email window to resume typing my email message, the <Control><B> button will start behaving weirdly:

- Pressing <Control><B> will either move the cursor to the start of the line

- If there are some words that were already embolden at the front of the line, pressing <Control><B> will move the cursor to the rightmost position of the embolden words.

As I use <Control><B> frequently to embolden words while composing my email text, this re-positioning of the cursor to the start of the line whenever I press <Control><B> after I switch back to the Thunderbird window from a different application is very irritating, as the new words that I want to type in BOLD will now be inserted at the wrong place at the beginning of the line (or just after the last embolden word in the current line) instead of the current position.

However, I do not know if this behaviour is just affecting me, or is a general issue with Thunderbird 115. I did not experience this problem in Thunderbird 102.

Thanks. NJ
creator: njwong88

title: Deaktivace účtu
content:
Dobrý den, poprávám funkcionalitu, která v TB imho není. Dosud mi to nevadilo, ale s příchodem nové verze ano.

Mám účet, který je neaktivní. Nechci jej mazat, ale potřebuji, aby když kliknu na Přijmout zprávy, byl ignorován. Což není.

Dříve bylo možné, když jsem chtěl přijmout zprávy z konrétního účtu, využít ikonky nahoře pro Přijem zpráv (a zvolit, zda všech účtů nebo konrétního). Dnes musím rolovat dolů, hledat účet, a až když jej najdu, přes pravé tlačítko vynutit příjem zpráv. Je to zdlouhavé a pracné.

Nedalo by se to nějak vrárit - ten výběr účtů pro příjem? Nebo aspoň umožnit totální deaktivaci účtu...

Děkuju
creator: yucikala

title: Inconsistent handling of text/calendar by Thunderbird
content:
Thunderbird is inconsistent with calendar invites

I want the option to download an ics file of invitations into my calendar app for every invitation I get per email.

This works when the email contains an MIME part as follows ``` Content-Type: text/calendar; charset=utf-8; method=REQUEST; name=meeting.ics Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable ```

It does not work in the case of ``` Content-Type: text/calendar; charset="utf-8"; method=REQUEST Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 ```

Is the whole point here the missing `name` specifier? Could Thunderbird make up a name in such cases, e.g., simply offer to save `meeting.ics`?

How else can I get this out?

NB: My workplace does not allow Thunderbird access to our calendar server due to ascribed "Thunderbird bugs" leading to data loss. I cannot say anything about this being true, current, whatever... But I prefer my other calendar program (Fantastical) anyway;-)
creator: jochen.kuepper

title: RSS feed no longer shows in-line youtube video.
content:
It seems that with every Thunderbird update there is a 1-in-3 chance that the RSS functionality that displays a youtube video within the message, will break.

It's often resolved when the next version of Thunderbird is rolled out - but not everytime.

I am curious what causes this, it seems like a feature that should be stable. What's the problem - is it testing ? Do the majority of the DEVs consider it a niche part of the product and not worth that much time ? I don't intend to criticise as I'm sympathetic to this. I just need to know if I should look elsewhere for another client - that's all.

Thanks for the work you do.

Peter Rhodes.

content:

I was greeted with the Supernova Update when starting Thunderbird the other day and ever since then I can not use my work email anymore. I always get errors saying I couldn't be logged in. The errors say "User is authenticated but not connected" or that the server cannot be reached at all.

I have googled and tried disabling IPv6 networking, have deleted cookies and passwords and reentered my credentials in the Thunderbird browser window that comes up, have deleted the account from TB and added it again, nothing helps.

Is there anything else I can try? I'm on MacOS 13.4.1 and the Office365 email account is one from GoDaddy originally that had to be migrated to Microsoft at some point but is still partly managed by GoDaddy or whatever that whole arrangement is.

I'd really appreciate any help.

Thanks, Chris

title: Thunderbird problems - I'm unable to set-up an existing account on a new laptop!
content:
Hi all,

Whenever I buy a new laptop, I find it a really challenging process to get my emails working on Thunderbird!

I have a work email address - ie. @companyname

When I start the process for setting-up the existing email on the new laptop, it starts well, Thunderbird tells me it has 'found your account set-up' and asks me to submit credentials.

When I try and configure settings, the answer is "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password"

I have tried to follow the settings on the help page - https://www.ionos.co.uk/help/email/general-topics/settings-for-your-email-programs-imap-pop3/ - same answer

I have gone back to my old latop, copied the configuration on the email address (which is a different configuration again?!) input it on the new laptop - still no luck!

I'm sure this is a pretty basic problem, but if anyone can help, that would be amazing - I can't really start using my new laptop until I can access my work emails!

Many thanks in advance,

Karim

"Configuration could not be verified. If your username and password are correct, it's likely that the server administrator has disabled the selected configuration for your account. title: Thunderbird 115 authentication problems
content:
Yesterday, thunderbird 115.3.1 was automatically installed. Since then, all my Microsoft accounts do not work anymore. I think the problem is this: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202.

I've been messing around with the imap url, smtp server and oauth2 settings for a day now, without fixing the problem.

I have one profile with multiple e-mail accounts (more than 10, under which gmail, hotmail, live and outlook accounts) in it. They used to authenticate with oauth2, but now I cannot get that to work anymore. I can get receiving mail to work (even with oauth2), but sending mail (smtp server settings) are behaving different and unexpected every time. Some accounts can send an e-mail, and after restarting thunderbird not anymore. Other accounts have not been able to send an e-mail at all. I'm talking, for instance about 2 Live mail address behaving differently, even with the same settings (url, protocol etc).

Another major pain is the following (and I've not read about other people having that same problem, yet): I've logged into the outlook popup and given the thunderbird app access rights again, but after restarting thunderbird about the half of those credentials are gone again (in thunderbird settings Saved password). And I can start all over again?

What can I do?!

title: Use of storage
content:
Hace tiempo me aparecía una opción en el margen inferior derecho que me mostraba el uso de almacenamiento del correo en mi servidor web. Sin embargo recientemente ésta a dejado de aparecer en todas mis cuentas, de múltiples servidores diferentes, en todos los casos a la vez. Solicito información para saber cómo puedo hacer que vuelva a aparecer, o si se trata de una incidencia (bug), tengan conocimiento de esta para solventarlo a la mayor brevedad posible. Muchas gracias por su labor y por mantener activo este proyecto, ya que es de gran utilidad para multitud de personas.

Some time ago I used to have an option in the bottom right margin that showed me the mail storage usage on my web server. However, recently it has stopped appearing on all my accounts, on multiple different servers, in all cases at the same time. I request information to know how I can make it appear again, or if it is a bug, please letting you know so that you can solve it as soon as possible. Thank you very much for your work and for keeping this project active, as it is very useful for many people.
creator: gonzalogeladorodriguez

title: Thunderbird email rejected by Gmail
content:
Email Send from Thunderbird gets : \- These recipients of your message have been processed by the mail server: xxxxxxxxxxx@gmail.com; Failed; 5.3.0 (other or undefined mail system status) 

   Remote MTA gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com: network error - SMTP protocol diagnostic: 550-5.7.26 The MAIL FROM domain [mindspring.com] has an SPF record with a hard
550-5.7.26 fail policy (-all) but it fails to pass SPF checks with the ip:
550-5.7.26 [65.20.63.171]. To best protect our users from spam and phishing,
550-5.7.26 the message has been blocked. Please visit
550-5.7.26  https://support.google.com/mail/answer/81126#authentication for more
550 5.7.26 information. v13-20020a2e960d000000b002c033848085si9415366ljh.54 - gsmtp

When send from Earthlink Webmail, NO Problem. I upgraded Thunderbird... No help.

Gmail POSTED the following:

Email authentication requirements & recommendations

We require that you set up these email authentication methods for your domain. Authenticated messages: 

   Help protect recipients from malicious messages, such as spoofing and phishing messages.    Help protect you and your organization from being impersonated.     Are less likely to be rejected or marked as spam by Gmail.

Set up email authentication for each of your sending domains at your domain provider. In addition to following the instructions we provide, you should also refer to your domain provider's email authentication instructions. To verify messages are authenticated, Google performs checks on messages sent to Gmail accounts. To improve email delivery, we recommend that you always set up SPF, DKIM, and DMARC for your domains. Make sure you're meeting the minimum authentication requirements described in Sender Guidelines. Messages that aren’t authenticated with these methods might be marked as spam or rejected with a 5.7.26 error. If you use an email service provider, verify that they authenticate your domain’s email with SPF and DKIM. We recommend you always use the same domain for email authentication and hosting your public website. SPF SPF prevents spammers from sending unauthorized messages that appear to be from your domain. Set up SPF by publishing an SPF record at your domain. The SPF record for your domain should reference all email senders for your domain. If third-party senders aren't included in your SPF record, messages from these senders are more likely to be marked as spam. Learn how to define your SPF record and add it to your domain. DKIM Turn on DKIM for the domain that sends your email. Receiving servers use DKIM to verify that the domain owner actually sent the message. Learn how to turn on DKIM for your domain. Important: Sending to personal Gmail accounts requires a DKIM key of 1024 bits or longer. For security reasons, we recommend using a 2048-bit key if your domain provider supports this. Learn more about DKIM key length. DMARC DMARC lets you tell receiving servers what to do with messages from your domain that don’t pass SPF or DKIM. Set up DMARC by publishing a DMARC record for your domain. To pass DMARC authentication, messages must be authenticated by SPF and/or DKIM. The authenticating domain must be the same domain that's in the message From: header. Learn how to add a DMARC record at your domain. We recommend you set up DMARC reports so you can monitor email sent from your domain, or appears to have been sent from your domain. DMARC reports help you identify senders that may be impersonating your domain. Learn more about DMARC reports. When you set up DMARC, you can then optionally set up BIMI to add your brand logo to messages sent from your domain. Learn how to add your brand logo with BIMI. ARC ARC checks the previous authentication status of forwarded messages. If a forwarded message passes SPF or DKIM authentication, but ARC shows it previously failed authentication, Gmail treats the message as unauthenticated. We recommend that senders use ARC authentication, especially if they forward email regularly. Learn more about ARC authentication.

creator: NORTONKATE

title: "Empty Junk" + "Compact" ???
content:
9/29/23, 2:21 AM

Mike said 

   Ah - I see !!! 
   Why is this ONLY true for the "Junk" folder ?!?! 
   What I do is right click "Empty Junk" & "Empty Trash", then left click "File" (at the top) and "Compact Folders".

Toad-Hall

It's exactly the same for all folders as I stated in the compacting explanation of how mbox files work and how they need periodic cleanup. But it's particulary noticeable in Junk because there is the option to Empty the Junk. However, if you have an imap mail account, then the 'Inbox' may already be set up to compact aka expunge. That would be located in 'Account Settings' > 'Server Settings' under 'Message Storage'.

The 'File' > 'Compact folders' should be compacting all the folders.

Modified September 29, 2023 at 2:24:11 AM PDT by Toad-Hall

==============================================================

10/10/2023

Toad-Hall,

Like I said, I am an IT Professional.

This make no sense at all to me. Why should the "Junk" folder be any different than other folders ?!?!

I usually "Empty Junk" (DOES NOT clear "Size") & "Empty Trash" then "File", "Compact Folders".

NOW - An extra step is required to "Compact" the "Junk" folder (that clears "Size") !!! I would not know "Compact" the "Junk" folder was necessary if I did not select "Size" to be displayed (Nor do any of your other users !!!). If "Size" is NOT selected, users have no idea that the "Junk" folder continues to GROW !!!

creator: wagtail1

title: ISP passwords, as distinct from "retail" ones
content:
I used to understand this stuff, but have now aged out (at 91) and am totally lost. In the old days, starting with the 3-bar menu symbol, there was a path to reach the place where Thunderbird stored the passwords needed to get access to one's ISP accounts. If that still exists, I can't now find it.

I have a new Dell laptop that I am trying to activate. Comcast does not accept the PWs (that I have written down), so I want to find them on this older machine where they still work. Following TB's instructions, the expected "Saved Passwords" box does not appear; instead we get "Saved Logins". "Logins" is apparently a synonym for what I might call "retail" passwords, used to access bank, vendor, &c accounts, but these are distinct from network-access accounts. (In general, I think TB fails to distinguish adequately between the two password categories, but that's another question.)

So the question is: how do I get access to the ISP passwords stored on this old, working, machine, so I can use them on the new one?

I am using 115.3.2 on win11.
creator: wagtail1

title: Thunderbird 115 - Problems with Message List Display
content:
After upgrading from 102 to 115 I noticed 3 problems with the way Message Lists in e-mail folders are being displayed.

I set my Inbox message list display options to: Table View, Sort By: Received, Ascending, Grouped by Sort. This gives me groups of Older, Last 14 Days, Last 7 Days, Yesterday and Today with arrows to collapse or expand the groups. I keep the first 4 groups collapsed and only group Today expanded.

Problem 1: When I navigate to a different folder then back to Inbox, all the groups are now expanded and must be re-collapsed. In 102 the Message List Display would remember the collapsed/expanded state of each group while 105 the state for all groups is changed to expanded.

Problem 2: In 102, when a group is collapsed the Message List Line shows for the group shows only the collapse/expand arrow, the group name and the number of messages in the group. Example: " > Last 14 Days (2) "

In 115, when a collapse is executed, the group name line below is not properly erased so that From, Received, and Size fields show the From, Received and Size from the message that previously was on that specific screen line which is the top message in the newly collapsed group. Example: " > Older (19) " Example: " AT&T > Last 14 Days (2) 9/3/2022, 4:29 PM 1.6 MB " Example: " LinkedIn V Today (6/6) 8/20/2023, 1:18 PM 42.5 KB " (Other fields may behave similarly but I have not seen it because those fields were blank anyway)

Problem 3: This occurs in 115, and in 102 which I have previously reported but did not get fixed in 115. When the popup requesting file cleanup pops up and continue is clicked, when it finishes the Message list display options Sort by > Grouped By Sort becomes unchecked and my message list is no longer grouped by sort. See: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1371381

(PS I love the new access to the Message list display options so I don't have to search through multiple levels of view options to find and re-check Grouped by sort. However WHY did you use that Icon instead of the standard 3 line hamburger Icon??? The Icon you used looks like the Windows 10 Task View Icon)

Thunderbird 115.3.1 (64 bit), Windows 10 Home, 22H2
creator: gtalbott202

title: "403 Forbidden" error when trying to connect to university Gmail account with Thunderbird 115
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for all my email accounts and calendars, all of which are Google accounts. A week ago, a message in Thunderbird from my university Gmail account asked me to sign in again. This was a separate, smaller Google window with my email address already there, and a button "Next", presumably to enter my password or go to a university sign-in page. But when I click next, it just goes to a white page with "403 Forbidden" written. The URL at the top that it is apparently trying to go to is a university security/authentication thing.

Ever since then, this is the only result I get when trying to connect to this Gmail account. I have deleted the account from Thunderbird and tried re-connecting it in many ways, entering the server settings manually (with OAuth2), etc., and this same thing always happens. I have also tried deleting the cookies from this account, and clearing my entire Firefox cache and cookies. Please let me know what other details I can give.

For the record, I am using Ubuntu 22.04, but I recently tried this on a Mac, and all the exact same things happened with Thunderbird. However, using web-based Gmail works fine (Ubuntu and Firefox), and I can also connect to this email account with the Mac Mail client normally.

Thank you

title: Thunderbird stopped downloading POP3 AT&T/Yahoo emails
content:
2 weeks ago (9/27), Thunderbird 102.15.1 stopped downloading emails from AT&T/Yahoo POP3 account.

On 9/29, I upgraded to 115.3.1, but still getting no downloads from that account, though on the Yahoo web interface, I can see emails are coming in.

POP server: inbound.att.net, Port 995 (default) TB 115.3.1 on Windows 10 PC

AT&T is my ISP, and my email address has their swbell.net domain, hosted by Yahoo.

Other swbell.net POP accounts with same configuration on this installation of TB are still downloading emails, as are IMAP accts. (Though IMAP accts are not AT&T/Yahoo ones.)

I emptied Trash and compacted the inbox to no avail. Also deleted Inbox.msf, and let Thunderbird rebuild it, again to no avail.

Clicking on the “Get Messages” icon results in the bottom status bar saying “Checking Inbox for new messages…”, but nothing happens, and after a few minutes, that line disappears.

Does anyone have other suggestions? Thanks in advance, Ed

title: Moving profile to new PC - no messages
content:
Hi,

I have been having difficulties moving Thunderbird profiles to new PC's. It has happened to me twice now where I have moved my profile and Thunderbird can't see my messages on the new PC. I have followed the instructions here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer# and: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

I copied the profile from the old PC to an ext drive, and then moved it to the new PC in the proper location: C:\Users\mike\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird

On the new PC, I go into the Profile chooser window using "thunderbird -p" and I don't see the new profile. I have also tried copying my old profile over top of an existing profile on the new PC as described in the above articles, and when I start Thunderbird, I still don't see my messages.

I must be missing something, as the process seems pretty straightforward. Has anyone else experience this?

I am on Supernova 115.3.2 on Windows 11.

Thanks.

title: ALLEGATI EMAIL
content:
Ciao a tutti. Da quando ho installato l'ultimo aggiornamento 115.3.2, succede una cosa alquanto strana che prima chiaramente non succedeva. Strana e scomoda.

Aprendo in una nuova scheda un allegato, lo stesso lo vedo tranquillamente.

Chiudendo e riaprendo Thunderbird, la scheda rimane ma l'allegato scompare riportando in schermata tale messaggio:

Indirizzo non interpretabile Uno dei seguenti protocolli (imap) non è registrato oppure non è consentito in questo contesto. È necessario installare del software aggiuntivo per aprire questo indirizzo.

Quando clicco "Riprova" scompare anche questo messaggio e sono costretto a ricercare l'allegato nella posta e riaprilo.

Qualcuno sa come risolvere questo problema davvero fastidioso?

Grazie!
